intro: Pitcairnia brachysperma, commonly known as the short-seeded pitcairnia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a dense, water-holding structure. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of red and pink. Pitcairnia brachysperma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to indoor growing conditions.
